item.description:
Free event! April meeting of the Boston New Tech Meetup - 16th edition! This event is 21+, due to alcohol being served.

Come learn about 6 innovative and exciting technology products and network with the Boston/Cambridge startup community!  Each presenter gets 5 minutes for product demonstration and 5 minutes for Q&A.  Please follow @BostonNewTech and use the #BNT16 hashtag in social media posts: details here.

Products & Presenters:

  1. CampusBash / @CampusBash - The all-inclusive, one-stop hub for all events on your campus & other nearby schools (Murtaza Jafferji) http://campusbash.com
  2. SPLASHSCORE / @SPLASHSCORE - Gamifies your Facebook activity to identify and reward influential users (Sean Naegeli) http://www.splashscore.com
  3. Thumbs Up / @ThumbsUpApp - Simple mobile app lets you and your friends rate TV shows in real time (Cass Sapir / @CassSapir) http://www.thumbsupapp.com
  4. i4class - Revolutionizes classrooms with powerful technology for teachers, students & parents (Ron  Ayotte) http://i4class.com
  5. GreenBean Recycle / @GBRecycle - Gamified recycling gives you real-time impact feedback and refunds to you or charity (Shanker Sahai) http://gbrecycle.com
  6. Indivo X / @IndivoHealth - Open-source health record platform engages patients in managing health (Daniel Haas) http://indivohealth.org

Agenda:

6:00 - Setup time for presenters

6:30 to 7:30 - Networking with beer, wine, non-alcoholic beverages and an assortment of appetizers provided by Boston.com

7:30 - Presentations, Q&A

Directions & Parking:

Upon entering The Boston Globe site, you can either continue straight to park under the building (recommended) or turn left to park in front of the building (limited space). Here are directions & a Google map.

Public Transportation: Take the MBTA RED LINE to the JFK/UMASS Station and walk a few blocks south on William T Morrissey Blvd. The Globe will be on your right.

Enter the lobby through the front door. Give your name at the security desk and you will be directed to the Globe Lab space.

Sponsor and Host:

Sponsorship and meeting space has been graciously provided by:

 

 

 

 

Boston.com - The region’s leading digital destination for information about our community, and active involvement in it – free, wide open to all, and comprehensive. The site provides the best and broadest coverage of breaking news and things to do and exclusive, top quality news, sports, and entertainment content. Follow @Bostondotcom and join them on facebook. www.Boston.com
item.how_to_find_us: Give your name at the security desk in the main lobby and you will be directed to the Globe Lab space.
item.name: Boston New Technology Meetup April 2012 #BNT16 (21+ Event)
